resources.string: No permission to read the file.
An error occurred while reading the file.
On mobile Chrome, bookmark export is not available.
On your computer Chrome, open menu (⋮) \u003e Bookmarks and lists \u003e Bookmark manager, then menu (⋮) \u003e Export bookmarks.
On mobile Chrome, bookmark export is not available. On your computer Chrome, open menu (⋮) \u003e Bookmarks and lists \u003e Bookmark manager, then menu (⋮) \u003e Export bookmarks.
Brave on mobile supports bookmark import and export.
On mobile Edge, bookmark export may not be available.
Follow Microsoft Edge favorites guide. If needed, use Favorites manager (⋯) to export favorites as HTML.
1. Set up Naver Whale sync first
Official Naver Whale documentation focuses on bookmark sync across devices.
Follow Whale sync guide, then check desktop Whale bookmark manager for HTML export options.
Samsung Internet may not provide direct mobile HTML bookmark export.
Use Samsung Internet bookmark/sync guide, then export from a desktop browser if needed.
On mobile Firefox, bookmark export may not be available.
On your computer Firefox, open Bookmarks \u003e Manage bookmarks, then Import and Backup \u003e Export Bookmarks to HTML.
On iPhone/iPad Safari, direct bookmark export is not available.
On Mac Safari, open File \u003e Export \u003e Bookmarks.
On mobile Opera, bookmark export may not be available.
On your computer Opera, open Bookmarks manager and use Export bookmarks to HTML.
On mobile Vivaldi, bookmark export may not be available.
On your computer Vivaldi, open Bookmarks manager and export bookmarks as HTML.
1. Set up DuckDuckGo Sync and Backup
DuckDuckGo official guide focuses on sync/backup rather than HTML export.
Use DuckDuckGo sync guide, then move bookmarks through another desktop browser if HTML export is needed.
Official Kiwi documentation for bookmark HTML export is limited.
Move bookmarks to a desktop Chromium-based browser, then export bookmarks as HTML.
On mobile Yandex Browser, bookmark export may not be available.
On your computer Yandex Browser, open Bookmarks manager and export bookmarks as HTML.
Arc official guide is focused on importing data from other browsers.
Use Arc migration guide first. If HTML export is required, move data to a browser that supports HTML export.
Internet Explorer is deprecated and may not be available on your device.
In Internet Explorer, open Favorites \u003e Import and Export, then export favorites to a file.
On mobile %1$s, bookmark export may not be available.
On your computer %1$s, find Bookmark/Favorites manager and export to HTML.
2. Save the HTML file to phone
Tap the button below and choose the exported HTML file to import bookmarks into the app.
A different bookmark file was detected. If you continue, the existing imported bookmarks will be removed and replaced.
